However knowing this, normal mode gives unlimited lives and constant checkpoint, so it is still easily beatable despite the controls.

The best and my favorite Megaman. I had the original for NES when it cam out in the mid 90s. Beautiful colors, crisp visuals, not to difficult AI but still challenging stages. And not to mention the music. The best Mega Man music since MM3. The characters are thought out well. Flame Man has an Arabic theme, Yamoto Man has a Japanese theme, etc.

I used to love this game as a kid and I still do as an adult. I love the retro graphics and retro music. Perfect dose of nostalgia. I think the Megaman game series has some of the best video game music in all of the NES library.  I am so glad Capcom rehashed this game on Google Play Store with some optimizations for Android devices. It's nearly FLAWLESS! It does take a little bit of time to get used to the touchscreen virtual controls especially because there are certain areas in some stages that are a little tricky to navigate across with touchscreen controls that would have been easier with tactile buttons of actual physical controls but it's completely playable to the end. You can work around most of those tricky areas using the touchscreen controls with just the right timing and precision. But some other tricky areas are much easier to navigate across with certain items like the Rush Jet Adapter when playing this game with the built-in touchscreen controls. But nevertheless, this version is completely playable from beginning to end. I beat this version of this game in Normal mode about a day after I got it from Play Store. Check out all the badges I got from this game on my Play Games profile (which I also love about this version of Megaman 6 - Google Play Games integration).  HINT: Don't play Wind Man's stage until you get the Rush Jet Adapter from Plant Man. There is a tricky spot in Wind Man's stage you cannot easily get across without it using touchscreen controls.  ALSO, you may have to tinker around with the speed in the game's settings to get better framerates. I set my speed settings to "High" and the game plays quite well with fluid animation.  THANK YOU CAPCOM FOR ALL THOSE WONDERFUL CHILDHOOD MEMORIES YOU GAVE ME THROUGH VIDEO GAMES!!!

I am a hardcore mega man fan since 11 years old - the kind of fan who buys all games, t-shirts and limited edition toys - and following all the critics I refrained from buying this title at first. But I decided to buy one of the series to give it a shot and I am not disappointed at all. Criticism was too harsh on this one. For the price it's a good, solid fun play. I liked it. Only real problem was the lack of joypad support.

replyContent: We're sorry you're not enjoying the game. Consider playing in fast mode.  It may improve your experience.

content: Make sure you put the game speed on fast and leave it on normal mode. I beat all of the robot masters in about two hours worth of playing (remembered the order from when I was a kid). I love the auto charge, auto saving, and infinite lives!
